description: Reticulum v1.1.3 - data packet and proof test vectors

constants.link_mdu_derivation: floor((MTU(500) - IFAC_MIN_SIZE(1) - HEADER_MINSIZE(19) - TOKEN_OVERHEAD(48)) / AES128_BLOCKSIZE(16)) * AES128_BLOCKSIZE(16) - 1 = 431
constants.proof_not_encrypted_note: PROOF packets over LINK destinations are NOT encrypted (Packet.py:198-200). self.ciphertext = self.data
constants.data_encrypted_note: DATA packets over LINK destinations ARE encrypted via destination.encrypt() → Token(derived_key).encrypt()

PROVE_NONE.behavior: Never generate proofs automatically. Application must explicitly call packet.prove().

PROVE_APP.behavior: Call the proof_requested callback. If it returns True, generate and send a proof.

PROVE_ALL.behavior: Always generate and send proofs for all incoming packets automatically.

proof_flow: 1. Receiver gets a DATA packet over a link
4. If PROVE_APP: call proof_requested callback, prove if True
9. Send proof as Packet(link, proof_data, PROOF) with context=NONE
10. Proof packet is NOT encrypted (passthrough for PROOF on LINK)

FAILED.description: Proof not received within timeout period

proof_generation_vectors.description: Proof for data packet 0: Empty plaintext
proof_generation_vectors.signer_note: Responder signs with identity Ed25519 private key (Link.py:279: self.sig_prv = self.owner.identity.sig_prv)
proof_generation_vectors.not_encrypted_note: Proof packets over LINK destinations skip encryption (Packet.py:198-200)
proof_generation_vectors.context_note: prove_packet() creates Packet(self, proof_data, PROOF) with default context=NONE

proof_generation_vectors.description: Proof for data packet 1: Single byte 0x42
proof_generation_vectors.signer_note: Responder signs with identity Ed25519 private key (Link.py:279: self.sig_prv = self.owner.identity.sig_prv)
proof_generation_vectors.not_encrypted_note: Proof packets over LINK destinations skip encryption (Packet.py:198-200)
proof_generation_vectors.context_note: prove_packet() creates Packet(self, proof_data, PROOF) with default context=NONE

proof_generation_vectors.description: Proof for data packet 2: Hello, Reticulum! (17 bytes)
proof_generation_vectors.signer_note: Responder signs with identity Ed25519 private key (Link.py:279: self.sig_prv = self.owner.identity.sig_prv)
proof_generation_vectors.not_encrypted_note: Proof packets over LINK destinations skip encryption (Packet.py:198-200)
proof_generation_vectors.context_note: prove_packet() creates Packet(self, proof_data, PROOF) with default context=NONE

proof_generation_vectors.description: Proof for data packet 3: Exact AES block (16 bytes of 0xAA)
proof_generation_vectors.signer_note: Responder signs with identity Ed25519 private key (Link.py:279: self.sig_prv = self.owner.identity.sig_prv)
proof_generation_vectors.not_encrypted_note: Proof packets over LINK destinations skip encryption (Packet.py:198-200)
proof_generation_vectors.context_note: prove_packet() creates Packet(self, proof_data, PROOF) with default context=NONE

proof_generation_vectors.description: Proof for data packet 4: Full link MDU (431 bytes)
proof_generation_vectors.signer_note: Responder signs with identity Ed25519 private key (Link.py:279: self.sig_prv = self.owner.identity.sig_prv)
proof_generation_vectors.not_encrypted_note: Proof packets over LINK destinations skip encryption (Packet.py:198-200)
proof_generation_vectors.context_note: prove_packet() creates Packet(self, proof_data, PROOF) with default context=NONE

proof_validation_vectors.validator_note: Initiator validates with peer_sig_pub = responder's identity Ed25519 public key (Link.py:412)
Initiator validates with peer_sig_pub = responder's identity Ed25519 public key (Link.py:412)
Initiator validates with peer_sig_pub = responder's identity Ed25519 public key (Link.py:412)
Initiator validates with peer_sig_pub = responder's identity Ed25519 public key (Link.py:412)
Initiator validates with peer_sig_pub = responder's identity Ed25519 public key (Link.py:412)

invalid_proof_vectors.description: Invalid proof: tampered hash (first byte flipped)
invalid_proof_vectors.failure_reason: proof_hash != original_packet_hash (hash mismatch, fails at step 1)

invalid_proof_vectors.description: Invalid proof: tampered signature (first byte flipped)
invalid_proof_vectors.failure_reason: Ed25519 signature verification fails (valid hash, invalid signature)

invalid_proof_vectors.description: Invalid proof: signed with wrong key (keypair[2] instead of responder keypair[1])
invalid_proof_vectors.failure_reason: Signature valid for wrong key, fails verification with correct peer_sig_pub

bidirectional_vectors.description: Bidirectional data+proof vectors demonstrating asymmetric signing keys
bidirectional_vectors.encryption_note: Encryption is symmetric — both directions use the same derived_key/Token
bidirectional_vectors.signing_note: Signing is asymmetric — responder uses identity Ed25519, initiator uses ephemeral Ed25519

vectors.description: Initiator sends DATA, responder generates proof (signs with identity Ed25519)
vectors.proof_validator_note: Link.py:412 — initiator: peer_sig_pub = destination.identity.get_public_key()[32:64] (responder identity Ed25519 pub)

vectors.description: Responder sends DATA, initiator generates proof (signs with ephemeral Ed25519)
vectors.proof_signer_note: Link.py:286 — initiator: self.sig_prv = Ed25519PrivateKey.generate() (ephemeral, sent in LINKREQUEST)
vectors.proof_validator_note: Link.py:189 — responder: peer_sig_pub_bytes = data[ECPUBSIZE//2:ECPUBSIZE] (initiator ephemeral Ed25519 pub from LINKREQUEST)

burst_vectors.description: Burst of 10 sequential DATA packets over same link with proofs
burst_vectors.ordering_note: DATA packets have no ordering at this layer; sequence is application-level
burst_vectors.receipt_independence_note: Each packet produces an independent PacketReceipt with its own timeout and proof tracking

TRAFFIC_TIMEOUT_FACTOR.usage: Multiplier for link RTT in timeout computation

TRAFFIC_TIMEOUT_MIN_MS.usage: Minimum timeout in milliseconds for link-based receipts

DEFAULT_PER_HOP_TIMEOUT.usage: Seconds added per hop for non-link receipt timeout

TIMEOUT_PER_HOP.usage: Alias used in PacketReceipt timeout computation

MAX_RECEIPTS.usage: Maximum receipts tracked; overflow causes FIFO culling

PATHFINDER_M.usage: Max hops; used as default when hop count unknown

receipt_state_machine.description: PacketReceipt state machine: states, transitions, and proof validation flow

CULLED.description: Receipt removed due to MAX_RECEIPTS overflow (FIFO)

transitions.condition: proof_hash == packet_hash AND signature validates with peer_sig_pub

transitions.callback: timeout callback (if set, in new thread)

transitions.trigger: MAX_RECEIPTS overflow in Transport job loop
transitions.condition: timeout set to -1 by Transport, then check_timeout detects -1
transitions.callback: timeout callback (if set, in new thread)

proof_validation_flow: 1. Receive proof packet (PROOF type on LINK destination)
2. Proof is NOT encrypted (passthrough for PROOF on LINK)
4. If link proof: call validate_link_proof(proof_data, link)
9. If valid: status → DELIVERED, proved = True

culling_behavior.mechanism: FIFO: oldest receipt popped, timeout set to -1, check_timeout() called
culling_behavior.result: Status becomes CULLED (0xFF), timeout callback fires

receipt_proof_matching_vectors.description: Proof matching uses full 32-byte packet_hash, not truncated 16-byte destination hash

vectors.description: Proof matching for data packet 0: Empty plaintext
vectors.matching_note: Proof matching uses full 32-byte hash (PacketReceipt.hash), NOT truncated 16-byte

vectors.description: Proof matching for data packet 1: Single byte 0x42
vectors.matching_note: Proof matching uses full 32-byte hash (PacketReceipt.hash), NOT truncated 16-byte

vectors.description: Proof matching for data packet 2: Hello, Reticulum! (17 bytes)
vectors.matching_note: Proof matching uses full 32-byte hash (PacketReceipt.hash), NOT truncated 16-byte
